quote-source: The Economist’s Babbage writing about cash-transfers and AIDS prevention. I’m fascinated by the success of conditional cash transfer schemes such as Brazil’s Bolsa Familia, since these assume (sensibly) that the poor will use their money to maintain and improve their living conditions, and not waste it on short term goals.
quote-text: … it has often been hypothesised that if teenage girls were given an alternative incomeÂ âÂ one that might, for instance, allow them to stay on at school, they would be less likely to get infected. It is a plausible hypothesis but one that has not, until now, actually been tested.
